EmailTemplate.textOnly:
The Challenge Network / Society
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you so much for applying to become Youth Board Member for The Challenge Society’s Youth Board in your local community. Votes have been counted and verified, but unfortunately on this occasion you were not successful. However, your details have been placed on the reserves list and if spaces become available we will be contacting you! In the meantime, we are very happy to offer you an alternative role with The Challenge Society. Read on to find out more!
Be a Challenge Ambassador! Challenge Ambassadors are Graduates of the Summer programme who get directly involved in the organisation through working with the Marketing, Development and Staffing teams. It’s an amazing chance to see what goes on behind the scenes of The Challenge Network as well as re-connecting with your fellow Challengers and learning numerous new skills that look great on your CV and UCAS applications. As a Challenge Ambassador you can be involved in three ways:
Marketing Ambassadors support Marketing to promote The Challenge in schools and youth groups in their local area by attending assemblies, parents’ evenings and speaking with new Challengers. An excellent choice for anyone who wants to encourage other young people to do The Challenge! To register your interest in this role email: marketing.ambassadors@the-challenge.org
Media and Development Ambassadors represent The Challenge Network and young people in the media or to potential funders or supporters. This is an amazing experience for anyone interested in journalism or fundraising. To register your interest in this role email afua.kudom@the-challenge.org
Staffing Assessors help select mentors for the summer at staff assessment events. If you think you know what makes a great Senior Mentor or Programme Leader, then come and share your expertise! To register your interest in this role email: summer2012@the-challenge.org
As well as the Challenge Ambassador opportunity, we've also got another awesome once in a lifetime opportunity we’ve nominated you for...The Challenge is part of a wider programme called the National Citizen Service (NCS). As a Graduate of the NCS, you have been nominated to apply be a member of their prestigious leadership academy! This is a residential training programme where you can learn leadership, communication and problem solving skills. There are only 20 places for Challenge Graduates, so act fast! For more information, any questions and to fill out an application form, click on this link: www.tinyurl.com/ncsleaders
We look forward to hearing from you.
Kind regards,
The Challenge Society
